column4: hello
i need some help ... http://images.torrentmove.com/show.php?id=66e7457680f9a765dbaf05a552b36a2d
i can't mount ntfs partition which installed windows
Reboot into Windows.  Run a full diskcheck on those volumes and then get back into Ubuntu.
It appears you were using Windows when a power failure occurred.  Windows locks NTFS volumes in such a scenario.
Rebooting into Windows, running a disk check and booting back into Ubuntu should fix it.
: i can't get into windows mode ... or even save mode
i mean...windows must be corrupts
That's not news to me.  Windows does not read its own file system way too many times.  I've had to recover client data using Linux and ntfs-3g.
You can force mount NTFS partitions though.  No guarantees there.
<drivetrax --- no sir
<jburd> --- i already force to mount that partition
but it doesn't work
When you try to load Windows, what error message do you see?
<jburd> some file system couldn't read
Can you get the exact error message?
<jburd> when windows is starting ... it just reboot

I'd suggest a better strategy for storing your personal data.  Don't store it in the same partition as the Windows installation.  Use a separate partition so even when you lose the OS, you can still recover data.
<jburd> i'll reinstall windows then let you know again later
read about restoring Grub back to the MBR before you do that.
